name: Christian Appalachian Project
description: Christian Appalachian Project (CAP) is building hope, transforming lives, and sharing Christ's love through service in Appalachia. Founded in 1964, CAP provides vital services for children, their families, and seniors living in deep poverty. Services include hunger and poverty relief, child and family development, disaster services, elderly services, home repair and reconstruction, youth empowerment, and Operation Sharing (food and essential items distribution). CAP serves thousands of people annually across Appalachia, with 89% of donations going directly to families in need.
source: Verified from official website, contact page, and multiple online sources
notes: Headquarters: 485 Ponderosa Drive, Paintsville, KY 41240. Main toll-free: 1-866-270-4CAP (4227). Volunteer line: 1-800-755-5322. Operation Sharing: 606-789-3148 (Paintsville), 606-523-5799 (Corbin). This location serves the Mount Vernon/Rockcastle County area. CAP is a 501(c)3 organization with 89% of donations going directly to families in need.
